attributes.action: Hold a debate in the Commons about the American gun control system
attributes.background: After the Vegas massacre, The Pulse night club shooting, San Bernardino, and a shooting yesterday in Fort Collins and countless other shootings, a debate is needed in the Commons about Gun control in the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017 in the US, 12,300 deaths have been caused by guns. 3,000 deaths are people who were under 18. There's been 286 mass shootings in the US. These figures don't include 22,000 annual suicides which use guns. If the UK had a similar population to the USA 1,000 UK citizens would die annually in comparison. 
http://www.gunviolencearchive.org/  
https://www.justfacts.com/guncontrol.asp  
https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2016/06/16/gun-violence-united-kingdom-united-states/85994716/

attributes.action: Introduce a maximum wage as a factor of the lowest paid employee's wage.
attributes.background: Wage gaps have got out of hand, meaning top earners are paid a ridiculous amount more then entry level staff. Often on a false pretense that hugh salaries attract the best candidates.  It just attracts the greedy.More people are struggling to make ends meet due to inflation driven by a skewed.
attributes.additional_details: impression of growth The average salary is distorted by excessively high wages while most people barely get by. This has driven up day to day living costs while every day workers buying power has decreased. A cap on how many times the lowest salary a company's top salary is would drive up that bottom salary and make wage distribution fairer, would equalise the housing market and boast the economy much more than 99% of money being in the hands of 1% of people.

attributes.action: Form a dedicated recovery/response unit on the QE2 bridge/dartford crossing/A282
attributes.background: Every day users of the QE2 bridge/ Dartford crossing have to endure horrendous queues as a result of stranded vehicles blocking the carriageway through breakdown or accident . Let's have a dedicated response team to get the lanes open asap
attributes.additional_details: With revenue of 160 million pounds last year surely a response team can be budgeted in to quickly remove stranded vehicles on the run up stretches north and south of the crossing as well as the A282 and move them to a safe place instead of waiting hours for recovery from the drivers own breakdown service or insurer. The loss to the economy must run into millions of pounds a year and creates havoc and misery for users and drivers in the surrounding areas

attributes.action: Save the Streetlighting on the A2 between Bexley and Dartford
attributes.background: The streetlights on this section of the A2 have recently been switched off. On further investigation it appears Highways England are to remove the lighting columns as they are life expired. This is ridiculous and a dangerous decision on such a busy road. Please help me to get the decision reversed.
attributes.additional_details: I spoke to a Highways England who confirmed that they were being removed. Only to tell me that the white lines would be refreshed as if that would suffice!

attributes.action: Magazines legally required to disclose when models have been photoshopped.
attributes.background:
1.6 million people in the UK suffer from eating disorders. I believe some of this comes from the high pressure placed on women and men to be thin and toned.
One main source of this is because of the beauty standards upheld in our magazines. Women and men are photo shopped into the "perfect" figure.
attributes.additional_details:
There is such a high pressure on people to fit into the mould that is projected through magazines. This mould for women is thin, toned, bid breasts, big bum and perfect skin. For men the mould is lean and muscly, six-pack and a large package. 

Pictures in magazines cannot be something people aspire to be because they aren't real body expectation. 

France has already introduced this law to help defeat eating disorders and promote a healthy body image, I believe we should too.

attributes.action: Return Welsh devolved powers to UK Government and Parliament
attributes.background: 20yrs of Devolved Powers have not delivered real benefit to the people of Wales and many people are disillusioned by the Assembly and failing public services.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/education/education-expert-lays-out-criticisms-12170188

https://www.theguardian.com/society/2014/apr/10/welsh-nhs-waiting-times-uk-tests-patients-wales

attributes.action: Change the law, employers to offer 48hr rest periods per week to night workers
attributes.background: Working nights comes with its heightened health risks. Obesity, diabetes, heart disease, lower life expectancy etc. Jet lag is certain. Working nights disorientated, whether it's physically demanding or operating machinery is a risk to health and safety. Please keep night workers healthy and safe
attributes.additional_details: Evidence has shown that a change in ones body clock affects the immune system and metabolism. When there is only a rest period of 24 hours in a week, most night workers will work a shift until 6-9am and try to readjust their body clock to suit their day off work. When there is only a 24 hour period off work this has a severe detrimental effect on ones immune system and health. Many have commonly become disoriented, tired and even ill. This is dangerous.

attributes.action: Stop speed-limited vehicles from overtaking during peak congestion periods
attributes.background: Speed-limited vehicles performing over-taking manoeuvres cause congestion on motorways and dual carriageways during peak periods. Such manoeuvres are slow in terms of time and distance and create bottle necks. Limiting these to outside of peak periods would ease congestion.

attributes.action: Demand an apology and a retraction of Trump's interference in British politics.
attributes.background: President Trump has given comfort to a far right, violent, British political party by re-tweeting their racist lies. Our government should summon the US Ambassador to inform him that interference in British politics in unacceptable and to demand an apology and a retraction.
attributes.additional_details: See http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-42166663

attributes.action: Reduce the overseas aid to 0.2% of GNI.
attributes.background: We should reduce our overseas aid budget of 0.7% of (GNI) to 0.2% of GNI to come in-line with other European Countries and America. Based on the £12b budget of 2015 this would leave us with an additional £8b which should be immediately allocated to the NHS and social care budgets.
attributes.additional_details: We also ask that all overseas aid should be means tested before any Country is allocated any money at all. This will stop the waste of hundreds of millions that goes to Countries with space programs for example or are fighting wars with their neighbours and their own people.

attributes.action: People Aid - govt pays your share of overseas aid to the charity you choose
attributes.background: Imagine you decide each year which UK charity/ies should be paid £300 (your share of the overseas aid). It could be a UK charity supporting foreign aid as at present or you may feel it would be better spent at home e.g. on a hospice, the local secondary school, animal welfare, medical research, etc.
attributes.additional_details: The aid budget will be about £14 billion a year over the next 5 years and there are about 48 million people on the electoral register for local elections. That's £300 per person per year. There are about 170,000 UK charities supporting both UK and foreign good causes. Examples - 1000 supporters of a local hospice or school could direct £1.5m goes there over 5 years; or through your local church 100 people decide to commit to a medical facility eradicating AIDS in Africa - that's £30,000 per year

attributes.action: Community Alarm Services should be permitted to use bus lanes without penalty.
attributes.background: We are firmly of the belief that Community Alarm Services are a vital emergency service in the community for vulnerable people. The service providers should be able to use bus lanes to speed up their travel time to their service users to reduce or prevent further injury and distress.

attributes.action: Stop UK foreign aid to all countries that mistreat minorities in appalling ways.
attributes.background:
Spending of foreign aid has to be used to the benefit of all citizens. Countries, such as Pakistan, that continue to mistreat their minorities must not receive aid any longer: 
Asia Bibi, Christian mother of five, in prison for alleged blasphemy since 2010. 
Ahmadi mosque attacked, Chakwal, 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
References:
Asia Bibi:
bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-38222680
Ahmadi mosque attack:
dw.com/en/the-persecution-of-ahmadis-in-pakistan-and-beyond/a-36748924
More examples:
Pakistani Christian school-boy beaten to death by Muslim classmates; Death sentence for Christian accused of WhatsApp “blasphemy”:
barnabasfund.org/Prayer/Prayer-Focus-1017#pakistan
Indian Church,Bibles torched in attack:
barnabasfund.org/Prayer/Prayer-Focus-1017#india
Afghan ex-Muslim persecuted:
youtube.com/watch?v=Tr_VGtTV8yY

attributes.action: Change the NHS guidelines asking people their sexual orientation
attributes.background:
In April of 2019 the NHS guidelines will be changed requiring nurses and doctors etc to ask people their sexual orientation no matter what their appointment is about. 

This is wrong as it is personal information and should only be needed if required. Please don’t let this happen.

attributes.action: Cap Insurance Prices For People Under 25.
attributes.background: Insurance prices for young drivers is too high, often being in the thousands for a car that will only cost a few hundred pounds. Similar petitions have been started in the past but this one is different as I propose that a power cap is put on cars.
attributes.additional_details: My idea is to introduce a similar system to motorcycles and limit the power of cars young people can drive for 3 years after passing their test. A limit of 1600cc, this lowers the power that a young driver can have therefore meaning that they cannot have a car that is too powerful for them to control, insurance companies can then cap out insurance making it lower for all people as there are less powerful cars being driven by young drivers, making the roads safer for everyone in turn too.

attributes.action: Make discrimination against dyslexic people illegal
attributes.background: I have Dyslexia. I went for an interview and was told that they wouldn't have me because it takes me too long to learn in a role because of my Dyslexia, even though I had the knowledge and could do the role with ease.
attributes.additional_details: If Dyslexia was a named as a disability then employers would know that they had to provide reasonable adjustments, such as extra time in training or learning a new job.

attributes.action: Make it an Offence Outside London to Park on Footpaths.
attributes.background: More and More Drivers are using the Footpaths to Park on, this causes a number of issue such as No consideration for the Disabled/Blind and Pushchairs where Children could run into the road, plus Damage being caused to the Footpaths due to them Not being made for Vehicles costing Money to repair.
attributes.additional_details: Very often people on Foot with Pushchairs and Disabled Scooters can Not get through which causes a Safety issue with people having to go out into the road with children in some cases, Footpaths as in the name are for people on Foot and Disabled Scooters, the Councils have to pay good Money in Repairs where they are not re enforced, this come go elsewhere to needed causes, many Drivers are just Lazy these days, London should Not be the Only place that Banned them, Not Equal and Wrong.

attributes.action: UK Government to impose trade sanctions on Venezuela, over human rights abuses.
attributes.background: Democracy has been betrayed in Venezuela. With top opposition politicians like: Leopoldo Lopez and Antonio Ledezma, being unlawfully arrested. The severity of the political crisis has triggered mass protests for months. Protests resulting in: nearly 5000 arrests; 163 deaths; 15,000 injured.
attributes.additional_details: Why should the UK Government fund a tyrannical state? A state that ignores International Human Rights Agreements, that they even co-signed. A state where the detention of the opposition is natural. In 2015, Venezuela exported $286 million worth of goods to the UK - most of which was mineral products (99.2%). The UK exports to Venezuela in 2015 amounted a total of $318 million. Although Venezuela may be an attractive source of investment for UK firms, I urge them to stop. Simply because the trade revenue enables Pres Maduro's suppression of basic human rights. The UK should impose embargo on the nation until democracy has been restored.

attributes.action: HGVs to be restricted to the slow lane only on motorways and dual carriageways
attributes.background: Due to the increase in serious road traffic accidents cause by HGVs we would like to see HGVs restricted to the slow lane on motorways and dual carriageways

attributes.action: To make Remembrance Sunday a national holiday for all ex service men/woman.
attributes.background: My husband was in the Army for 13 years, he was in The Kings Royals Hussars. During his time he served in the Gulf, Northern Ireland and Kosovo. Over the past few years, because of shift patterns, his work day has fallen on remembrance Sunday and he has been unable to parade with his comrades.

attributes.action: Train fare increases should be frozen or capped at 1%
attributes.background: As a long suffering commuter I'm sick of paying out substantially increased fares each year with little noticeable improvement to services. Trains constantly break down, are over-crowded, or the issue is with Network Rail (meaning they get massively compensated but pay back very little to us)

attributes.action: Exempt those giving evidence of Sexual Abuse from the Official Secrets Act.
attributes.background: When investigating cases of historical sexual abuse against children and young people many prominent accused were in positions of power and protected by Civil Servants and Military Personnel. These people were by the very nature of their job, subject to the Official Secrets Act.
attributes.additional_details:
If a true and factual finding of an individuals guilt or innocence is to be found it is essential that ALL evidence available should be disclosed, without fear of prosecution, to the investigating body by ANY person having relevant information.

This petition therefore calls upon HM Government to specifically exempt, by legislation, any person providing information to a statutory investigating body in relation to Sexual Abuse cases, irrespective of any act of Parliament they may be subject to.

attributes.action: Get rid of all school uniforms
attributes.background: I personally find most school uniforms ridiculously uncomfortable and believe that we, as students, should be able to wear anything we like to school within reason. I also believe that if anyone should go to school in a uniform, it should be the teachers.

attributes.action: UK Govt: Help to rebuild communities affected by the mudslides in Sierra Leone
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, recognise the immediate aid provided to Sierra Leone by the UK Government in the aftermath of the horrific mudslides. We ask the Government to continue to support Sierra Leone and to set out a long term strategy to help rebuild communities destroyed by the mudslides.

attributes.action: Double the mandatory sentence for possession of a Firearm
attributes.background: The UK and specifically urban inner city areas are blighted by gun crime. Murders, injury shootings and possesssion of Firearms (Section One) are increasing. The mandatory sentence for possession of such a Firearm at the moment is 5 years.Doubling this to 10 years would provide a massive deterrent.

attributes.action: Make cat calling, objectification and sexual harassment in the street illegal.
attributes.background:
We need to introduce a zero tolerance policy against cat calling and sexual harassment in the streets. 

There is currently nowhere to report these incidents and no penalty if caught.

France has introduced a law against catcalling which should be replicated in the UK.

attributes.action: Make Armistice Day a national holiday starting 2018, 100 years since end of WW1.
attributes.background: Previous petitions have failed, but lets not give up.  The great war needs to live on in the hearts and minds of the next and all coming generations.  Additionally, there is no bank holiday between August and Christmas, and many workers feel the need for a break during this time.

attributes.action: Urgently stop student loan sales which are happening now.
attributes.background: Despite the student loans crisis, on 31st October 2017, Jo Johnson MP said he was going ahead with the sale of student loans. If the loan sales go ahead, students' interest and loan payments will end up in the pockets of private investors. This marketisation of education needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: Even though there are three unfinished government inquiries into student loans at the moment, Jo Johnson announced he was proceeding with the sale of student loans. Loan sales should be stopped until the inquiries are completed. Loan sales crystallize loan terms so it is difficult for students to benefit from improvements made to loan terms. Loan sales also expose the taxpayer and student borrowers to risk of footing the bill for warranties and indemnities for sale arrangers and investors.

attributes.action: Make Leaving A Pet Dog Unattended In a Vehicle A Criminal Offence
attributes.background:
Every day we see dog owners leaving their pet dogs unattended in motor vehicles. Dogs DIE very quickly when left in vehicles - in all seasons. 

Sadly for many dog owners it is too late – they return to their vehicle to find their beloved dog is DEAD!!!
attributes.additional_details:
For a dog to die a death from hyperthermia while locked in car is painful and very traumatic – including the agony of repeated seizures prior to death….while the owner ‘JUST’ wanted to do some shopping! 

Let’s make it law that the attending Police / Fire officers MUST break into the vehicle and release the poor dog from dying. 

The Dog’s owner must be prosecuted for criminal abuse & endangering death  by deliberate & wanton neglect.

attributes.action: Rejoin the European Union in April 2019
attributes.background: The European Union consists of over 20 nations working to make a better life both for their citizens, and for the whole world. It offers fantastic trading opportunities as the largest free-trade area in the world. The international status and prestige of the UK would be enhanced by membership.
attributes.additional_details:
In June 2016 the people of the UK voted to leave the European Union. The government has repeated stated that it will respect this, and the the UK will leave the European Union, it will not debate whether the will of the people has changed, nor will it consider a referendum once the details of how the UK leaves become clear.

This petition proposes that the UK will leave the European Union. It will not rejoin by the back-door. We will join as any nation, with full public oversight.

attributes.action: Require the prominent labelling of palm oil on all products sold in the UK
attributes.background: Palm oil plantations are the main reason huge tracts of rainforest are destroyed every day, releasing huge amounts of carbon into the atmosphere. Endangered species are being pushed towards extinction. Refined palm oil also contains large amounts of harmful fatty acid esters, known to cause cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.rainforest-rescue.org/topics/palm-oil#start

http://www.saynotopalmoil.com/Whats_the_issue.php

https://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/ng-interactive/2014/nov/10/palm-oil-rainforest-cupboard-interactive

http://www.rainforestfoundationuk.org/palmoil

attributes.action: Move all voting days to weekends to avoid disruption in schools and industry.
attributes.background: The recent elections caused concern amongst a large number of parents,teachers and business owners.This was due to the disruption of schools being closed on a workday.Moving voting to a weekend would prevent this.

attributes.action: Ban all non-recycled (in UK) single use food containers and utensils.
attributes.background:
With current bio-technological alternatives to almost all disposable food container and utensil, it is unacceptable that current wasteful practices have not been eliminated from our society.

Until organisations can prove that all materials used in packaging is recycled, a total ban is required.
attributes.additional_details:
In early 2017 a petition 'Ban all non-recyclable/non-compostable packaging in the UK' was debated. Although this raised many valid and relevant points, it did not provide a clear strategy dealing with the problem. With the bio-plastic alternatives available, legislation is required to tackle this.

Although some big corporations have paid lip service to sustainability (E.G. In store coffee cup recycling schemes), the impact will alway be superficial.

Please read the original debate responses.

attributes.action: Make it ILLEGAL to sell chemical hair straighteners for young children.
attributes.background: Retailers know of the damage they’re causing to young mostly black impressionable girls. Scalp irritation, hair damage, breakage and loss.CHEMICAL BURNS on young skin for an unattainable beauty standard.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-breastcancer-hair-dyes/dark-hair-dye-and-chemical-relaxers-linked-to-breast-cancer-idUSKBN19X229

http://www.haroldsplace.com/say-no-to-relaxers-on-children-

http://www.curlynikki.com/2011/04/should-relaxers-be-used-on-children.html

attributes.action: Make all public body shaming in the media, and in public, a criminal offence.
attributes.background: 94% of teenagers girls have faced being body shamed - this causes teenagers to be body dimorphic, depressed, anorexic and in severe cases, can lead them to have suicidal thoughts. It is a very serious problem, especially in the era of social media and nothing is being done about it.
attributes.additional_details:
Body-shaming:
>The action or practice of humiliating someone by making mocking or critical comments about their body shape or size.

Body dimorphic disorder (BDD) is a mental disorder characterized by the obsessive idea that some aspect of one's own appearance is severely flawed and warrants exceptional measures to hide or fix it.

attributes.action: Increase Fines and Points for Using a Mobile Phone while Driving
attributes.background: As it has been Proven today’s Fine and Points are Not Working, the Police have said so, we can Still see Drivers using them each time we go out, seeing this Kills as Proven the Law needs to be much stronger, we have nearly been hit by a lorry being steered by one hand and coming over our side.
attributes.additional_details: These Drivers have not Learned anything by the last increase, White Vans seem to be the Worst offenders, Lives must be Protected on our roads from their actions, it may be a good idea to Increase the Points so that they could loose their Jobs to make them think, it’s No good after the fact where others are Injured or Killed, let’s Stop the Idiots that ignore the Laws.

attributes.action: Vaccinate badgers instead of culling
attributes.background: The Government have decided to extend the culling area and increasing deaths. This is based of little evidence and is destroying ecosystems. Why not just vaccinate them if it's a problem?
attributes.additional_details:
Also it is estimated that 6% of bTB cases amongst cattle are as a direct result of badgers, which is a small amount, so why not just vaccinate a few!
Sources:
https://www.badger.org.uk/can-the-cull

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-41228693

http://www.chesterstandard.co.uk/home/2017/09/13/gallery/wildlife-trust-is-opposed-to-badger-cull-in-cheshire-95089/

attributes.action: Abolish 3 points for vehicles with defective tyres CU30, change to a fine only!
attributes.background: Drivers get 3 points for defective tyres as it stands, I find this far too severe a punishment when combined with a fine as it leads to insurance being dearer. A fine is ample enough.
attributes.additional_details: Dvla offence code CU30

attributes.action: Make the rate of the living wage as recommended by the living wage foundation
attributes.background: The Tory government brought in the living wage to help eradicate poverty. I am calling for the living wage set by the government to be the rate set by the Living Wage Foundation, currently set at £8.45 per hour, and not the one set way below it.

attributes.action: Commit to increasing the size of the Royal Navy by at least 20% over 50 years
attributes.background: Historically, the Royal Navy was the best in the world. Now, it's barely in the top ten. We need to be secure, it's not a luxury but a requirement. While the existing fleet is well equipped, there aren't enough ships to be everywhere needed. 20% in 50 years isn't a huge increase, but it's a start.
attributes.additional_details: The Royal Navy currently has under eighty commissioned ships. Only 3/4 of those are operational at any one time. These numbers are too small, especially compared to the 430 ships of the US Navy or the nearly 500 ships of China. In 1945 at the end of the Second World War, the Royal Navy had 900 ships, today's navy is less than 1% the size of then. We don't need to increase back to wartime levels, but we do need to increase the Navy's size considerably.

attributes.action: Introduce a visa esta or esa system (like Canada/USA) for non-eu visitors to UK
attributes.background: Currently, USA, Canada and Australia require foreign visitors (including British people) to complete a visa entry application prior to travel. Anybody with a historical criminal record must apply for a police certificate and await clearance from those countries, before being allowed entry.
attributes.additional_details: Britons are being refused entry to Canada and Australia particularly, for historic criminal records - even childhood cautions and less serious records -such as drink driving twenty years ago. A similar system should exist in the UK to vet potential visitors from non-eu countries.

attributes.action: Carry out a comprehensive reassessment of the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: The national curriculum has become cumbersome and over reaching, pushing teachers to leave the field, and children to have heightened stress levels. Learning to pass tests is not going to give children a life long love of learning  nor is it taking in to account childrens individual needs.
attributes.additional_details: Children are not being given the chance to explore a love of learning, they are being taught to pass tests, and are being given work that was previously set at a much higher level. Staff have no time to cater for childrens needs at an individual level, because they just haven't got enough time, and it's not good enough. We should be encouraging future generations to learn, not putting them off early by giving them more than they can handle. The current system is just not working.

attributes.action: Cancel the £10bn for Help-to-Buy; give it to councils and allow them to build.
attributes.background: Theresa May has today pledged £10bn (unfunded) for Help-to-Buy. This will increase housing demand, not supply, adding further to the unaffordable property bubble. It ignores the systemic issues in Britain’s housing sector and will likely help those that need it least.
attributes.additional_details: We call on the government to, instead, use this £10bn to build truly affordable homes and address the fundamental issues in Britain’s provision of housing.

attributes.action: All pet abductors, ransomers, and thieves to get mandatory prison sentence.
attributes.background: They are as much of our family as our sons and daughters. Thieves, blackmailers, breeders, course hunters etc are stealing to order knowing the overstretched police have little resources to tackle this type of crime. VOTE NOW!
attributes.additional_details: If you had a pet you'd know what to do.

attributes.action: Affordable homes: amend law on new builds, compulsory purchases & shared schemes
attributes.background: Current law allows developers to build unaffordable homes (£175-£200k more for an area) on communal lands and on homes taken by compulsory purchases. Displaced residents are given less money than needed to relocate locally. Developers are still able to own sold homes via shared ownership schemes.
attributes.additional_details:
Change the rules of compulsory purchases to ensure displaced residents get replacement values (not market value) plus 10%
 
Require homes built on communal land or compulsory purchased homes to be no more than 110% of the market value for older homes.
 
Ban shared ownership schemes if the price is more than 110% of the market value of older properties. New build homes are escalating housing inflation with their pricing which is underpinned by shared ownership schemes.

attributes.action: Enforce all dog groomers must be qualified & registered under a regulating body.
attributes.background: I have recently had a terrible experience with a dog groomer,when investigating who I needed to report her too I realised that there is no one! no qualifications are needed and no regulating body to be accountable to. Please sign this petition,  together we can make a difference for our dogs.
attributes.additional_details: I spoke to the animal welfare who told me there is nothing anyone could do and the rspca wouldn't be interested! My dog is a teddy bear looking Lhasapoo with gorgeous teddy bear paws sadly he has now  been completely shaven, almost to the skin,she has even cut him on his chest and he has lost his whiskers.he was terrified when I picked him up. We really need the law to be changed and for all dog groomers to be qualified and accountable to a regulating body so this can not happen again to others.

attributes.action: Mandatory for ALL eye tests to include Pupillary Distance (PD).
attributes.background: Without the Pupillary Distance (PD) it is impossible to create prescription glasses, get the distance wrong and depending on how inaccurate it is, can cause the following symptoms: blurry vision, double vision images, headaches, nausea, and fatigue.
attributes.additional_details:
- 69% of the UK population wear prescription glasses
- Online retailers can be 40% cheaper than high street opticians
- It is unfair that people on lower incomes are forced to buy cheap     glasses when they could afford fashionable frames and lens if they could buy from online retailers.
- Opticians don't provide PD today pointing to Statutory Instrument (1984 No. 1778). This was last reviewed in ’84 the internet was just for email then!! So this badly needs an update.

attributes.action: Reduce Dartford crossing charges
attributes.background: Residents from Dartford and Thurrock  pay much reduced dart charge .  But people working on other side of the bridge pay a normal rate and even though you set yourself an online account - they still rip you off ! I spend ~£70 a month! Let's end this !

attributes.action: Age restrictions for buying corrosive products like bleach and drain cleaner
attributes.background: More than 96 people have been a victim of acid attacks in London alone this year. It’s too easy to purchase the products for making acid. There are currently no age restrictions. When paying for corrosives, it should be made necessary to pay by card which is then traceable.

attributes.action: Stop the proposed changes to funding for refuges and short term housing.
attributes.background: These proposals will remove the only guaranteed funding for refuges from the welfare system. Effectively preventing vulnerable women from paying part of the cost of their accommodation in refuges with housing benefit resulting in mass closures of refuges.
attributes.additional_details: Funding for supported housing paragraph 68 on page 26 of the 58 page document details the proposed changes. Housing benefit currently meets about half of refuge funding resulting in closures of many.These changes withdraw all guaranteed funding for refuges for vulnerable women fleeing abuse putting them at further risk. Closures of refuges would result in enormous increased costs for alternative housing for local authorities.
